subject: Re: [junit] Error while I run JUNIT test using ANT:
msgSnippet: hi, something i understood about your problem. it is better to check ur .class file path where it is and which path u r giving. i am not getting the exact path
messageBody:
hi,

something i understood about your problem.
it is better to check ur .class file path
where it is and which path u r giving.
i am not getting the exact path by seeing
this code.
don't mine it is better to view this
link http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm
i think it will give some more help to u.
i don't have enough time to go throw ur problem.
thanking you,

regards,
venkat.

--- suganya s <sugu_subramanian2581@...> wrote:

> hi,
> It seems that the junit runner is not able to locate
> your NoteAccess.class file. Check your classpath ...
> say if it is ${test.classes.dir}
>
> <fileset dir="${test.classes.dir}">
> <includename="**/NoteAccessTest"/>
> <exclude name="**/AllTests"/>
> </fileset>
>
> - suganya subramanian
>
>
> --- Sreenivasulu <vasu_usa2003@...> wrote:
>
> > Hi Everybody,
> >
> > I am running JUNIT test using ANT as follows in
> > build.xml file. I am
> > getting the following error.
> >
> > *****
> > <target name="run" depends="dist,
> > buildTestJar,init">
> > <delete dir="${reports.dir}/xml" />
> > <mkdir dir="${reports.dir}/xml" />
> > <delete dir="${reports.dir}/html" />
> > <mkdir dir="${reports.dir}/html" />
> >
> > <junit fork="yes" printsummary="yes"
> > haltonfailure="no">
> > <classpath>
> > <path refid="test.classpath" />
> > <fileset dir="${build-trs-jars}">
> > <include name="*.jar" />
> > </fileset>
> > </classpath>
> > <formatter type="xml"/>
> > <batchtest fork="yes"
> > todir="${reports.dir}/xml">
> > <fileset dir="test/noteaudit">
> > <include
> > name="**/NoteAccessTest.java"/>
> > <exclude
> name="**/AllTests.java"/>
> > </fileset>
> > </batchtest>
> > <!--
> > <test
> > name="com.bear.trs.test.noteaudit.AllTests"
> > haltonfailure="no"
> > outfile="TestResults-${TODAY}"
> > todir="${reports.dir}">
> > <formatter type="xml" />
> > </test>
> > -->
> > </junit>
> > <junitreport todir="${reports.dir}/xml">
> > <fileset dir="${reports.dir}/xml">
> > <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> > </fileset>
> > <report format="frames"
> > todir="${reports.dir}/html"/>
> > </junitreport>
> > </target>
> >
> > *****
> >
> > java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: NoteAccessTest
> at
> >
>
java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
> > at
> > java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native
> > Method) at
> >
>
java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:183)
> > at
> >
>
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:294)
> > at
> >
>
sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:288)
> > at
> >
>
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:250)
> > at
> >
>
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:310)
> > at
> > java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at
> > java.lang.Class.forName
> > (Class.java:115)
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
